title: Add examination board format support for quiz generation

requirements.text: Extend the backend document metadata structure to include an optional 'examinationBoard' field that can store examination board formats such as 'ABMA EXAMINATION', 'Cambridge', 'IB', etc.

quotes: Update on ask questions based on boards of exam for instance ABMA EXAMINATION format

acceptanceCriteria: Document metadata in backend/main.mo includes an optional examinationBoard field
The field accepts text values representing different examination boards
Existing documents without this field remain compatible

requirements.text: Add an examination board selector dropdown to the DocumentUpload component that allows students to optionally specify the examination board format (e.g., ABMA EXAMINATION, Cambridge, IB, IGCSE, None) when uploading study materials

quotes: Update on ask questions based on boards of exam for instance ABMA EXAMINATION format

acceptanceCriteria: A dropdown appears in the DocumentUpload form before or after file selection
Options include at least: ABMA EXAMINATION, Cambridge, IB, IGCSE, and a 'None/General' option
The selected examination board is sent to the backend along with the document upload
The dropdown uses the Malawi flag color scheme consistent with the app design

requirements.text: Update the useUploadDocument hook to include the selected examination board format when sending document metadata to the backend

quotes: Update on ask questions based on boards of exam for instance ABMA EXAMINATION format

acceptanceCriteria: The hook accepts examinationBoard as a parameter
The examinationBoard value is included in the backend uploadDocument call
The upload process completes successfully with the additional field

requirements.text: Display the examination board format in the DocumentList component for each uploaded document, showing it as a badge or label next to the filename

quotes: Update on ask questions based on boards of exam for instance ABMA EXAMINATION format

acceptanceCriteria: Each document in the list shows its examination board format if one was specified
Documents without a specified board show 'General' or no badge
The badge styling uses appropriate colors from the Malawi flag theme
The examination board information is clearly visible but does not clutter the interface

requirements.text: Modify the quiz generation logic in QuizPage.tsx to tailor question format and style based on the examination board associated with the document, with ABMA EXAMINATION format as the first supported board

quotes: Update on ask questions based on boards of exam for instance ABMA EXAMINATION format

acceptanceCriteria: When generating a quiz for a document with an examination board specified, the question format reflects that board's style
ABMA EXAMINATION format questions follow ABMA's typical structure and terminology
Questions for documents without a specified board use the current general format
The quiz interface clearly indicates which examination board format is being used

constraints: Do not modify the existing document storage or authentication logic in backend/main.mo
Maintain backward compatibility with existing documents that do not have examination board information
Use the single-actor architecture pattern already established in backend/main.mo
nonGoals: Implementing AI-based question generation that actually parses document content
Adding examination boards beyond the basic list (ABMA, Cambridge, IB, IGCSE)
Creating separate quiz templates for each examination board at this stage
Modifying the quiz results calculation or grading system
